_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Athlon Solutions believes in being a responsible corporate citizen and maintaining open, constructive dialogue with our neighbors.  

Athlon Solutions uses Ethylene Oxide (EO) and Propylene Oxide (PO).  These chemicals are used to manufacture Specialty Products such as surfactants and esters.  Our surfactacts and performance chemicals are used in consumer products and industrial applications as detergents, cleaning agents, and personal care products.



Accidental Release Prevention Program



To prevent accidental releases, this facility is in compliance with the EPA Risk Management Program and the OSHA Process Safety Management standard.



Significant chemical-specific prevention and mitigation steps found at the site include:



- Being prepared to handle unexpected rises in temperature and pressure by using automatic shut-off device and relief valves.

- Multiple layers of protections such as safety controls, including warning alarms, automatic shutdown systems and leak detectors.

- Identifying potential problems by continuously monitoring pressure in vessels and piping.

- Ensuring proper operation by regularly inspecting equipment.  

- Ensuring employees and contractors receive extensive emergency response, health care and safety training following regulatory and corporate guidelines.

- Training employees in start-up, operation, and maintenance of all equipment.

- Investigating safety and chemical related incidents and implementing corrective actions to prevent reoccurrence.

- Obtaining applicable regulatory permits.

- Performing routine audits (inspections) to ensure correct procedures are followed.

- Conducting process safety analysis and resolving identified hazards.



Five Year Accident History



This facility has had no accidental releases of ethylene oxide or propylene oxide over the past five years that meet the reporting criteria.



Emergency Response Program



This facility has an emergency response plan.  The site has a direct communicati

ons link to off-site responders in the case of emergency.  Hazmat team members are trained for Emergency Response.  Processes and equipment have combustible vapor detectors, water monitors, emergency shut-down instrumentation.
